subject: p19759491
History: Evaluation of the patient with cough.
Findings: PA and lateral upright chest radiographs were reviewed in comparison to. Current study demonstrates enlarged heart, replaced aortic valve and substantial mitral annulus calcifications, unchanged since the prior study. Cardiomegaly is unchanged. There is diffuse interstitial opacities as well as engorgement of azygos vein as well as bilateral small pleural effusions, findings most likely consistent with interstitial pulmonary edema. An additional left lower lobe pneumonia is a possibility and potentially other areas of infection are present obscured by the interstitial pulmonary edema.
